data.meta_description: Graphic narratives are one of the world’s great art forms, but graphic novels and comics from Europe and the United Stat...

Introduction: Global South Comics on Their Own Terms James Hodapp

1 Pages of Exception: Graphic Reportage as World Literature Dominic Davies

2 Latin America’s Tinta Femenina and Its Place in Graphic “World Literature” Jasmin Wrobel

3 An Alternative Worldliness: Verbal and Visual Experimentations in Fī shiqqat bāb el-loq (The Apartment in Bab El-Louk) Dima Nasser

5 A Sociological Approach to Francophone African Comics (1978–2016) Sandra Federici

6 Born in the “World”: Leila Abdelrazaq’s Writing and Art as World Literature Allison Blecker

7 Utopias Gone Wrong: Representing the Dystopic Urban in the Indian Graphic Narrative Debadrita Chakraborty

8 Opening Up a World and the Temporal–Normative Dimension: Keum Suk Gendry-Kim’s Grass as World Literature Jin Lee

9 Between the Saltwater and the Desert: Indigenous Australian Tales from the Margins Catherine Sly

10 A Case Study of Sita’s Ramayana, Diasporic Negotiations, COVID-19, and the Television Serial Ramayana Shilpa Daithota Bhat

11 Wakanda as a Sustainable Smart Society: Africanfuturism in Marvel’s Black Panther Jana Fedtke

12 Neoliberal Ideologies in Menggapai Bintang (Reach for the Stars) Mohd Muzhafar Idrus, Habibah Ismail and Hazlina Abdullah

13 “Long Live the Waste!”: Junk Food Bites Back in Jung’s Approved for Adoption Sheng-mei Ma
